* Chips Supported:SC6230 (sun690)                                                           *
*===========================================================================================*
* Current Shared Projects. All the following projects must be labeled                       *
* Chip     |  SC6230   |                                                                    *
* ---------|-----------|                                                                    *
* PCB      |  sun690   |                                                                    *
* Catagory | CE Reader |                                                                    *
* Type     |  BD/DVD   |                                                                    *
* I/F      |   SATA    |                                                                    *
* Prod #   |           |                                                                    *
*********************************************************************************************

                  Drive doesn't need to read BCA again when receiving
                  Dvd structure command Format 0x81/0x82.
                4.Tray is not closed after Warm-boot system.

F/W Version:    k.05
Date:           1/5/09
Project:        SUN710/SUN692
Case #:

F/W Version:    j.05
Date:           1/5/09
Project:        SUN710/SUN692
Case #:
Modified by:    hcchang
Files Modified: HAL_lasc.c,HAL_lasc.h,svo_dsp.c,svo_dsp.h,Svo_lib.c,coef_values_B0.c/h,
                coef_values_B2.c/h,sc6230_B0_SUN710_coef.zip,sc6230_B2_SUN710_coef.zip.
Description:    Update DSP code to V1.72 and modify relative setting for APC loop.
                In v1.72, the PI-action can now also be applied without dependence from FWCTRL bit 1:
                * The P-action is enabled by using thresh_P_gain value different from zero
                * The I-action (integrator) is enabled by using Gthr_read value different from zero
                So, compared to legacy code (before FW integrator was introduced), the only thing that you need to do
                is to initialize the correct value for Thresh_P_gain to control P-action gain
                When Thresh_P_gain is determined, you can further increase Gthr_Read of integrator loop in order to improve
                the response time of the loop. Because P-action is working in parallel with integrator action,
                no overshoot will happen even with faster response time and there is totally no FW interaction needed
                to adjust to correct read APC setpoint: the continuous integrator action will track temperature dependency
                , so that static error stays around 0 under all conditions.

F/W Version:    K.73
Date:           7/30/08
Project:        SUN690/SUN830/Sun673/BCM1600
Issue #:
Modified by:    Wells Lu
Files Modified: DataBase.txt svo_sta.c svo_lib.c HAL_afe.c HAL_afe.h svo_para_673.h
Description:    1. Calculate avgFEpp, avgBSpp, avgSRFO and avgFOO when svoPrvtVar_focusP2PCount is greater than 1
                   during FE PP measurement. Because of header noise from DVD-RAM, FE PP measurement fails sometimes.
                   After all retries go out, svoPrvtVar_focusP2PCount is less than 8. In original baseline, both
                   avgFEpp and avgBSpp will be set to 0 to force FE PP measurement. After modified, firmware  will
                   calculate correct avgFEpp, avgBSpp, avgSRFO and avgFOO if at least two successful measurement are
                   got, for the DVD-RAM re-startup.
                2. Add protection in case FE PP measurement fail during the DVD-RAM re-startup.
                3. Set fc of FE LPF to 15k to suppress header noise.
                4. Modified FE_SMSTEP_TH_RAM from 18 to 50.
                5. Modified messages and clean up code.

Description:    1. Re-arrage the controllers and filter groups for DVD-RAM disc.
                   DVD-RAM Support speeds:
                      1) 2X CLV                L-group   (read & write)
                      2) 3X CLV                M-group   (read & write)
                      3) 3X-5X PCAV                      (read & write)
                         zone 0  ~ 16: 6XCAV   M-group
                         zone 17 ~ 34: 5XCLV   M-group
                      4) 6X-12X PCAV                     (read & write)
                         zone 0  ~ 24: 12XCAV  H-group
                         zone 25 ~ 34: 12XCLV  H-group
                      5) 16X CAV               UH-group  (read only)
                2. Copy M-group tracking controller to L-group.

F/W Version:    J.30
Date:           02/06/08
Project:        SUN673
Issue #:
Modified by:    Wilhelm Ohlinger
Files Modified: svo_para_672.h
Description:    Fixed a problem with Tray In  Tray Out with 673 platform.
                  The tray control timer defines were rescaled when we do a tray out
                  because we changed the SVOPLL frequency by /32 as a work around for the
                  Renesas motor driver.  The rescaling of the timer values was required
                  because the SVPPLL was the clock used for the ARM Peripherals
                  (timers...)  Since we switched to the 25MHZ as the source of the ARM
                  Peripherals, then the tray timer values should not have been rescaled
                  anymore.

F/W Version:    H.15
Date:           11/06/07
Project:        SUN673/SUN690
Issue #:
Modified by:    Erwin Rademakers
Files Modified: 1. InitARM.c
Description:    Temporary solution to allow read/write access to all registers (some registers are not able to be accessed, address range 0xB000xxxx)
                Enable bit HAL_AHB_ARM2SC_ASWDEN, this bit enables a timeout on the AHB bus.  When the timeout is reached the bus transaction is terminated and a value of 00h is returned. Write transactions will complete but will not update the registers.

                5. Changed .MCP files to make project buildable with current settings
                6. Added AL directory for future Abstraction Layer files
